DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain FDG-Avid Tumor Detected At Distant Metastasis Site Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator that specifies whether or not FDG-Avid tumor detected at distant metastasis site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain FDG-Avid Tumor Detected At Distant Metastasis Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.:A radiologic finding indicating high uptake of FDG by a solid tumor during positron emission tomography (PET)._The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying._Used to indicate position, location, or state._A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredName: FDG-Avid Tumor Detection At Distant Metastasis Anatomic Site
Property.preferredDefinition: A radiologic finding indicating high uptake of FDG by a solid tumor during positron emission tomography (PET)._The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying._Used to indicate position, location, or state._A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors._Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: A radiologic finding indicating high uptake of FDG by a solid tumor during positron emission tomography (PET).
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.

A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
